newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai interbank rate eases, baht firms late.
newsitem.headline: Thai interbank rate eases, baht firms late.

text.p: The Thai overnight interbank rate eased to 12.50 percent in late trade on Wednesday from 13.50 earlier and 13.00-13.50 late on Tuesday on higher liquidity, dealers said.
Liquidity was easing slightly due to heavy dollar selling for baht and the Bank of Thailand's fund injection through its bond repurchase market operations.
"The interbank rate seemed to be in the downtrend. But any sharp fall of interbank rate below 10.00 percent this week is unlikely," said one dealer at a foreign bank.
The baht rose to 25.292-25.296 to the dollar late from 25.308-25.318 earlier on the American unit's weakness abroad, dealers said.
"There was dollar selling here in the afternoon following the U.S. unit's fall against other majors," said one currency dealer.
The one-month dollar/baht swap premium declined to 8.00/8.70 satangs per dollar late from 10.00/11.00 in early morning.
The mid-rate was fixed unchanged at 25.32 against the dollar. -- Tang Nguyen (662) 252-9950
